intro: Phalacroloma obtusifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf phalacroloma, is a member of the Phalacrolomaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to specific regions in Africa, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
